intro: Alafia sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping alafia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Alafia sarmentosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to cascade from containers or hanging baskets.
